intro: Tithymalus verrucosus, commonly known as the warty tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of hairy, warty leaves that are often covered in fine, white to grayish pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Tithymalus verrucosus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
